procedure.summary: Pour the acid into the milk.
procedure.description: Fill a measuring cup with 1 cup (237 ml) of whole milk minus 1 to 2 tablespoons (15 to 30 ml). Next, add 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of fresh lemon juice or white vinegar to the milk. You can substitute 2% milk or heavy cream for the whole milk if you prefer.

procedure.summary: Stir the acid and milk together well.
procedure.description: After you’ve added the lemon juice or vinegar to the milk, use a spoon to mix the two together. Be sure to blend them well so the acid is fully incorporated into the milk.

procedure.summary: Let the milk mixture sit for at least 5 minutes.
procedure.description: Once the milk and acid have been mixed together completely, allow the mixture to stand at room temperature for 5 to 10 minutes. That will give it time to thicken up and curdle slightly so you’ll have sour milk. The recipe makes 1 cup (237 cup) of sour milk. However, you can easily halve, double, or triple it based on your needs.
